I've been told by a lot of people that I should write a book of rules for dating. I know I'll never write a book, but I'm going to start my list right here. It's going to be ongoing, so keep checking this post for updates. 

Sara's Dating 101

1. You should almost always make the first move when sexual activities are involved. I say almost because sometimes girls want to be vixnes and prove that we like sex too, but if you start it, it makes the girl feel so much more special. It makes her feel like she's wanted.

2. When a girl says she loves you, don't respond with 'whatever'. 

3. No matter how tired you or her are, a phone call to say goodnight and I love you should always be a must. Seeing it typed over AIM is not very meaningful. 

4. Opening a car door or holding a door open whenever you two enter a building should be a frequent act. Sometimes even pulling out her chair at dinner is called for. 

5. Buy her cards. Birthday, Valentine's Day, anniversaries, even just to say you care about her. 

6. A single flower of her favorite one is more romantic than a dozen of a kind that's not her favorite. 

7. If you know there's an event -- concert, movie, play -- that means a lot to her, go with her. Even if it's not something you'd enjoy, it'd mean a lot to her and making her happy should make you happy.

8. Mention her in your profile. It may seem stupid to you, but it means something to her. And if you're doing something with her, have it in your away message. Instead of just 'Dinner' have 'Dinner with *insert name here*'. 

9. Offer to drive when you go out on dates.

10. Call her. It doesn't have to be lengthy conversations, just call to say hi or that you were thinking about her. And by all means, when you say you'll call, actually CALL HER.  

11. If you promise something, try your hardest not to break it.

12. When you say I love you, always make sure you say 'I' love you, not just 'love you'. That one letter means so much more to a girl then you will ever know.

13. At a restaurant, always tell the hostess your name, number and seating preference. Don't make her do it. 

14. If there's something that she likes a lot, like a certain flavor of a candy, make her a bag of just that flavor. For instance, she likes orange Runts better than any other kind. Go through boxes of Runts until you get enough orange ones to fill a box or sandwich bag. You don't have to do this often, once would be enough. But, it would really show how much you care. 

15. The little things always matter, always. 

16. Stay in with her at least one night every few weeks. Cuddle, watch movies, make dinner, do anything you want. Just show her you enjoy spending time with her alone.

17. If she likes bubble baths, make one for her. If she's had stressful day or week, buy her bubble bath, light a few candles in the bathroom and let her relax in the tub. If you can get in there with her, do it. If not, be waiting for her after and give her a massage or just lay with her. 

18. Even if you aren't the best cook in the world, cook her a meal every now and then. 

(From Tiffany)

19. If you're having a fight and she walks out/drives off/goes to hide in another room, FOLLOW HER. 

20. If you're having a bad day, don't keep the bad stuff from her--she tells you, she wants to know in return.

(Me Again)

21. If you're mad for some reason, no matter if its because of something she did -- tell her. Even if its something stupid, she'll still want to know. Whenever you're mad girls automatically think it's their fault, so clearing up her worries would make things better.


Ok, that's all I got right now. Trust me, there will be more. If you have anything you want added, just comment. <3

So, how's everyone doing? I've been a little lazy in updating lately, so I figured it was time for a real one. My last few days of work for the summer are closing in. I'm going on leave from the 20th of July to the end of August sometime. I have to go home since I won't have a place to live because of the apartment move-out and move-in dates. Mom and dad moved in their house yesterday so, I'm excited to go home to a real home. It's the first time I've had a real home since last August and I'm looking forward to it. Class will be over on the 29th and I have my midterm tomorrow, a paper due Monday on a book I haven't finished, another book to read and write another paper and another test before the final. Summer classes are good in the sense that you only have one class to work on, but they move so fast and you have a test every week and so much to do. I don't like that they are so busy, but I guess it can have it's perks. 

Chad was supposed to come down this weekend, but the chances of him coming are starting to look slim. I'm not happy. I know I can't expect him to come whenever I want him to, but I'd been planning on him coming this weekend since before he left after Summer I. This was supposed to be my best weekend of the summer...Chad coming to visit, 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory' comes out on Friday, the new Harry Potter book on Saturday...but, now I might not have my boyfriend to make my weekend fun. At least Meg's birthday is tomorrow and she's having a party on Friday night so, I'll get to celebrate with her. That should be fun. :) 

Speaking of Chad, I've planned out his birthday present. I found out that CKY is doing a show at The NorVa in Norfolk on Sept. 11th. Even though it's on a Sunday, I decided that Chad and I can go do to Norfolk on Friday after class and spend the whole weekend. If it's warm, we can go to the beach or go to Busch Gardens and just spend the weekend together. Then on Sunday, we can meet Joey and hang out all day then go to the concert and then drive back to Radford after the show. I asked him about it last night and he sounded excited. He said it was a great idea and it'd be a good birthday present. I'm sure by then I will have enough money to go and besides, two tickets for the CKY show are cheaper than one of our tickets for Green Day. Which our Green Day tickets for August are Chad's birthday present to me and he says he's getting me something else, but I really don't want him to. Those tickets were $90 and that's more than enough for him to spend on my birthday. I'm already making my list for my parents though. So far, I'm only concerned about getting a laptop. They said it would be joint Christmas and birthday which is perfect. I just need a new computer. I really want a satellite radio subscription or an IPod, but I guess I'll just have to see. I hate the radio because of commercials and stuff and I figure that either one would be great investments/gifts for me. Just hopefully I can talk my parents or my brother into helping me out with it. There's also about a million cds/dvds that I want for my birthday....Laguna Beach Season One *I'm a dork, I know*, Love Metal Archives Vol. One *I'll just have to suffer and watch it on my computer*, all of The 69 Eyes cds, The Rasmus' new cd, CKY3 since it's the only one I'm missing now, and many, many more. The only way I'll ever get all the music and movies I want is if I win a shopping spree to Amazon.com or something. haha Which will never happen.

It's time for me to go study for my midterm before work. I close tonight and tomorrow night so, I'll only have a few hours to study after work tonight. Love you all! <3

I feel so bad for what happened in London today. It's really shocking and I feel like this should tell us something. I just feel so unsafe anymore. I mean, the incident in London heightened our terror alert in all the big cities and I just feel like you can't go anywhere anymore without having to be worried that there's going to be some terror attack. 9/11 caused this same sense of fear in me, I didn't want to leave my house. But, then it was different because I was in West Virginia and I didn't know anyone who lived in any big cities or near any big cities. Now that I have so many friends that live in the D.C. area...to think that an attack may happen there and someone I know, a friend or even my boyfriend, could get hurt, it's really scary. I just hate all this. All this fighting and war and terrorism...it's scary. 

My thoughts are with all the people of London.

I miss Chad. I know I was just with him on Monday, but I still miss him. It really is hard to go from living with someone and being around them 24/7 to not seeing them at all. But, we love each other and I know we can make it through not being around each other for awhile. Even though it's planned to where we're seeing each other almost every other weekend which really isn't all that bad, but it still feels like forever. Ugh, listen to me complaining. I really shouldn't complain so much...there are people out there is way worse relationship situations who have to go longer without seeing their significant other. I should just be glad that I have such a wonderful boyfriend who loves me. I love saying that, he does love me. He really does. :D This past weekend was awesome! I met some of Chad's family, we went out to eat, went to the Great Falls Park, spent lots of time in his pool, and just had quality time with each other. We both really needed to see each other so the whole weekend just made things better. 

Ok, I'm tired and I think I'm going to go lay down and read a little. <3

30. For once, I feel like I've finally found real and lasting love.

32. One day I want to drive across the country. I want to start out and drive through the north, go from Washington state down to the end of California, then drive back through the south. I want to go to as many states as possible.
33. My other dream trip is to backpack through Europe. I have a list a mile long of all the things I want to see and do.

In a room with big floor-to-ceiling windows, a king size canopy bed with velvet drapes to close everything out, rose petals and candles everywhere, and 'Kissing You' from Romeo + Juliet on repeat.

Reading is one of my biggest passions and I love being able to sit down and read something and be transported to another place; especially places that seem like a fantasy.

Hey everyone! I know it's been awhile, ok a LONG time since I've updated but I really haven't been using this prized little journal as much as I should. I get my first pay check on Friday so, we'll see how good it's going to be. haha 

First semester is almost over...it went by so fast! I can't believe that I am getting ready to be a second semester sophomore, almost a junior. People weren't lying when they told me that college goes by extremely fast. The sad thing is, I don't know what I want to do anymore. I went into college so sure of myself and what I wanted to do for the rest of my life and now I'm starting to question it all. Don't get me wrong, I love writing and I love the idea of my working at a magazine someday but...that someday is a long way off. It takes so long to get where you want to be in the world of journalism and I don't know if I want to wait 10 or 15 years to make a comfortable living. Yes, I know every job takes time and you don't just start out at the top but, other jobs are easier to work your way up in. I have so many ideas in front of me...law school, possibly pharmacy or even being a wedding planner. I would love to be a wedding planner...or maybe an all around event planner. But, again I run into my parents and family not thinking that that profession will provide a comfortable enough living for me. I know money isn't everything and they say that too...but I want a profession where I don't have to worry every month if I can make ends meet and that I have enough money to pay all my bills plus do things that I want to do. I don't want to have to scrape just to be able to buy a new shirt when I want to. Sadly though, this is what happens to a lot of people once they get out of college. They end up getting a degree in biology and working as the manager of a Denny's. I want to be able to get a job that actually relates to what I go to school for and allows me to live comfortably. It's so strange to have to think about these things...think that you'll have to support yourself instead of being able to rely on your parents for most things. It's scary in a way. I'm so scared that I'll make the wrong decisions or end up in the wrong job. I just wish there was some test I could take that would say "This is your job and this is what you would be good at". But, you have to figure it out for yourself and no one can tell you...and I've never been good at making important decisions. I just want to make my parents proud of me in the end of all this. After they pay so much for my schooling, I just want them to know that I made something out of myself. I'm going to start researching things. Jobs, professions, where I can get with certain degrees, etc. There's so many things out there that you don't even think about until it's too late and I want to know all of my options and possibilities before I make a serious decision.
